item.title: Hasien add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Hasien add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Hasien add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Hasien add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Hasien add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Hasien add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Without music, life would be a mistake." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Hasien add a quote by Bill Keane
item.description: "Yesterday is history, tomorrow is a mystery, today is a gift of God, which is why we call it the present." -- Bill Keane

item.title: Hasien add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "That which does not kill us makes us stronger." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Hasien add a quote by Sylvain Reynard
item.description: "Kindness is never wasted." -- Sylvain Reynard

item.title: Hasien add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Hasien add a quote by Ovid
item.description: "Chance is always powerful. Let your hook be always cast; in the pool where you least expect it, there will be a fish." -- Ovid

item.title: Hasien add a quote by James Branch Cabell
item.description: "The optimist proclaims that we live in the best of all possible worlds; and the pessimist fears this is true." -- James Branch Cabell

item.title: Hasien add a quote by Richard Hughes
item.description: "Do your bit to save humanity from lapsing back into barbarity by reading all the novels you can." -- Richard Hughes

item.title: Hasien add a quote by Sir Francis Bacon
item.description: "Some books should be tasted, some devoured, but only a few should be chewed and digested thoroughly." -- Sir Francis Bacon

item.title: Hasien add a quote by Samuel Johnson
item.description: "Curiosity is, in great and generous minds, the first passion and the last." -- Samuel Johnson

item.title: Hasien add a quote by Diane Duane
item.description: "Reading one book is like eating one potato chip." -- Diane Duane

item.title: Hasien add a quote by Socrates
item.description: "There is only one good, knowledge, and one evil, ignorance." -- Socrates

item.title: Hasien add a quote by Arthur Schopenhauer
item.description: "Talent hits a target no one else can hit. Genius hits a target no one else can see." -- Arthur Schopenhauer

item.title: Hasien add a quote by St. Augustine
item.description: "The world is a book and those who do not travel read only one page." -- St. Augustine

item.title: Hasien add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Real generosity towards the future lies in giving all to the present." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Hasien add a quote by W.C. Fields
item.description: "I am free of all prejudice. I hate everyone equally. " -- W.C. Fields

item.title: Hasien add a quote by Howard Thurman
item.description: "Whatever may be the tensions and the stresses of a particular day, there is always lurking close at hand the trailing beauty of forgotten joy or unremembered peace." -- Howard Thurman

item.title: Hasien add a quote by Erick S. Gray
item.description: "Be more concerned with your character than your reputation, because your character is what you really are, while your reputation is merely what others think you are." -- Erick S. Gray

item.title: Hasien add a quote by John Greenleaf Whittier
item.description: "The windows of my soul I throw Wide open to the sun." -- John Greenleaf Whittier

item.title: Hasien add a quote by Osip Mandelstam
item.description: "My turn shall also come: I sense the spreading of a wing." -- Osip Mandelstam

item.title: Hasien add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "There comes a time when one must take a position that is neither safe, nor politic, nor popular, but he must take it because conscience tells him it is right." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Hasien add a quote by Dave Eggers
item.description: "Books have a unique way of stopping time in a particular moment and saying: Let’s not forget this." -- Dave Eggers

item.title: Hasien add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It matters not what someone is born, but what they grow to be." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Hasien add a quote by Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra
item.description: "The proof of the pudding is the eating." -- Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra

item.title: Hasien add a quote by W.S. Merwin
item.description: "Poetry is a way of looking at the world for the first time." -- W.S. Merwin
